perturbation.original_text: 10.3. NO ASSIGNMENT. Except as otherwise set forth herein, neither party shall transfer, assign or cede any rights or delegate any obligations hereunder, in whole or in part, whether voluntarily or by operation of law, without the prior written consent of the other party, which consent may be withheld at the other party's reasonable business discretion; provided, however, that either party may transfer this Agreement without prior written consent of the other to an Affiliate of such party, or to the surviving party in a merger or consolidation, or to a purchaser of all or substantially all of its assets.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.3. NO ASSIGNMENT. Except as otherwise set forth herein, neither party shall transfer, assign or cede any rights or delegate any obligations hereunder, in whole or in part, whether voluntarily or by operation of law, without the prior written consent of the other party, which consent may be withheld at the other party's reasonable business discretion. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may freely assign this Agreement to any third party at any time without notice or consent.
perturbation.explanation: The original text prohibits assignment without consent, except in specific cases. The modified text adds a contradictory sentence allowing free assignment to any third party, negating the previous restriction and creating uncertainty about the assignment terms.

perturbation.original_text: 7.3. TERMINATION. Subject to Section 10.11  [SURVIVAL], upon termination of this Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing party or, at the request of the disclosing party, destroyed unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement. Subject to Section 7.6  [USER DATA], the confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 7  [CONFIDENTIALITY] shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of three years.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.3. TERMINATION. Subject to Section 10.11  [SURVIVAL], upon termination of this Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing party or, at the request of the disclosing party, destroyed unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement. Subject to Section 7.6  [USER DATA], the confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 7  [CONFIDENTIALITY] shall not survive termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that confidentiality obligations survive for three years. The modified text states these obligations do not survive termination at all. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the duration of confidentiality post-termination.

perturbation.original_text: 5.2. Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other party in the event of any material breach of a term of this Agreement by such other party that remains uncured 30 days after written notice of such breach was received by such other party or, if the breach is not reasonably capable of cure within 30 days, such longer period, not to exceed 60 days, so long as the cure is commenced within the 30-day period and thereafter is diligently prosecuted to completion as soon as possible and in any event within 60 days.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.2. Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other party in the event of any material breach of a term of this Agreement by such other party that remains uncured 30 days after written notice of such breach was received by such other party or, if the breach is not reasonably capable of cure within 30 days, such longer period, not to exceed 60 days, so long as the cure is commenced within the 30-day period and thereafter is diligently prosecuted to completion as soon as possible and in any event within 60 days. Notwithstanding the foregoing, VerticalNet shall have the right to terminate this agreement at any time with or without cause.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stipulates specific conditions and a cure period for termination due to breach. The addition of a clause granting VerticalNet the right to terminate "at any time with or without cause" directly contradicts the initial provision, creating ambiguity regarding the actual termination rights and rendering the cure period potentially meaningless for VerticalNet.
